title: Library
description: Schema for submitting a molecular library.

alternate_accessions.title: Alternate accessions
alternate_accessions.description: Accessions previously assigned to objects that have been merged with this object.
alternate_accessions.comment: Do not submit. Only admins are allowed to set or update this value.

items.title: Alternate Accession
items.description: An accession previously assigned to an object that has been merged with this object.
items.comment: Only accessions of objects that have status equal replaced will work here.

spikeins_used.title: Spike-ins datasets used
spikeins_used.description: The datasets containing the fasta and the concentrations of the library spike-ins.

barcode_details.title: Single cell barcodes information
barcode_details.description: For single cell biosamples, the barcodes used to identify the biosamples.

plate_id.title: Identifier of the plate the single cell sample originated from
plate_id.description: The plate the single cell sample comes from.

plate_location.title: Position of the single cell sample on the plate
plate_location.description: The location (such as A1) of the single cell sample on the plate.

biosample.title: Biosample
biosample.description: The biosample that nucleic acid was isolated from to generate the library.

product_id.description: The product identifier provided by the vendor, for nucleic acids or proteins purchased directly from a vendor (e.g. total RNA).

lot_id.description: The lot identifier provided by the vendor, for nucleic acids or proteins purchased directly from a vendor (e.g. total RNA).

mint_mixture_identifier.title: MINT mixture identifier
mint_mixture_identifier.description: Identifier of the chromatin preps mixture.
mint_mixture_identifier.comment: Chromatin preps mixture identifier that is used in MINT-ChIP experiments.

construction_platform.title: Platform
construction_platform.description: The device used to construct the library.
construction_platform.comment: Use in cases of automated/proprietary library preparation (Fluidigm, 10X, etc.)

source.description: The vendor, for nucleic acids or proteins purchased directly from a vendor (e.g. total RNA).

nucleic_acid_term_name.title: Library material
nucleic_acid_term_name.description: SO (Sequence Ontology) term best matching the molecule isolated to generate the library (e.g. 'RNA' for a total RNA library, even if that library is subsequently reverse transcribed for DNA sequencing.)

dbxrefs.title: External resources
dbxrefs.description: Identifiers from external resources that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects..

items.title: External identifier
items.description: Identifier from an external resource that may have 1-to-1 or 1-to-many relationships with ENCODE objects.

nucleic_acid_starting_quantity.title: Nucleic acid starting quantity
nucleic_acid_starting_quantity.description: The starting amount of nucleic acid before selection and purification.

nucleic_acid_starting_quantity_units.title: Nucleic acid starting quantity units
nucleic_acid_starting_quantity_units.description: The units used for starting amount of nucleic acid.

extraction_method.title: Extraction method
extraction_method.description: A short description or reference of the nucleic acid extraction protocol used in library preparation, if applicable.

enum: Maxwell 16 LEV simpleRNA Cells Kit (Promega cat#: AS1270)
RNeasy Lipid Tissue Mini Kit (QIAGEN cat#74804)
RNeasy Plus Mini Kit Qiagen cat#74134 plus additional on column Dnase treatment

oneOf.comment: Historical extraction methods, not valid for new submissions.
enum: TruChIP chromatin shearing reagent kit Covaris cat# 520154, sonication Covaris M220, IP (home protocol), DNA isolation with QIAquick PCR Purification Kit cat# 28104.

fragmentation_methods.title: Fragmentation methods
fragmentation_methods.description: A list of nucleic acid fragmentation methods and restriction enzymes used in library preparation.

items.title: Fragmentation method
items.description: A short description or reference of the nucleic acid fragmentation protocol used in library preparation.

fragmentation_date.title: Fragmentation date
fragmentation_date.description: The date that the nucleic acid was fragmented. The date applies to all fragmentation methods specified.
fragmentation_date.comment: Date can be submitted in as YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSTZD (TZD is the time zone designator; use Z to express time in UTC or for time expressed in local time add a time zone offset from UTC +HH:MM or -HH:MM).

fragmentation_duration_time.title: Fragmentation duration time
fragmentation_duration_time.description: The amount of time a library spent undergoing fragmentation.

fragmentation_duration_time_units.title: Fragmentation duration time units
fragmentation_duration_time_units.description: The units used for time spent undergoing fragmentation.

library_size_selection_method.title: Size selection method
library_size_selection_method.description: A short description or reference of the size selection protocol used in library preparation, if applicable.

oneOf.comment: Historical size selection methods, not valid for new submissions.
enum: Only RNAs greater than 200 nucleotides. The inserts for the library will vary from ~ 100 - 700 base pairs.
Only RNAs greater than 200 nucleotides. The insert for the library will vary from ~ 100 - 700 base pairs.

lysis_method.title: Lysis method
lysis_method.description: A short description or reference of the cell lysis protocol used in library preparation, if applicable.

oneOf.comment: Historical lysis methods, not valid for new submissions.
enum: [NPB (5% BSA (Sigma), 0.2% IGEPAL-CA630 (Sigma), cOmplete (Roche), 1mM DTT in PBS)]
72 degrees for 3 minutes in the presence of Triton

crosslinking_method.title: Crosslinking method
crosslinking_method.description: A short description or reference of the crosslinking protocol used in library preparation, if applicable.

size_range.title: Size range
size_range.description: The measured size range of the purified nucleic acid, in bp.

average_fragment_size.title: Average fragment size
average_fragment_size.description: The average size of a fragment in the library, in bp.

fragment_length_CV.title: Coefficient of variation of library fragment length
fragment_length_CV.description: The coefficient of variation for the size distribution of library fragments expressed as a percentage.

fragment_length_SD.title: Standard deviation in library fragment size
fragment_length_SD.description: The standard deviation for the size distribution of library fragments.

queried_RNP_size_range.title: Queried RNP size range
queried_RNP_size_range.description: The measured size range of queried ribonucleoprotein (RNP), in kD.
queried_RNP_size_range.comment: This size range could be specified for eCLIP experiments and other RNA-binding protein assays.

strand_specificity.title: Strand specificity
strand_specificity.description: The forward or reverse strandedness of the library resulting from a strand-specific protocol.

oneOf.comment: Libraries that have indicated specificity in the past, not for new submissions.

depleted_in_term_name.title: Depleted in term
depleted_in_term_name.description: SO (Sequence Ontology) term best matching the nucleic acid that was diminished from the library.

type.title: Adapter type
type.description: Information (type or name) for adapter(s) specified in the adapter file. This info will be used to identify how the adapter file should be fed to a pipeline.

oneOf.comment: Adapters lacking end and read information, not for new submissions.

sequence.title: Adapter sequence
sequence.description: The sequence of an adapter used for library construction

linkers.title: Linkers
linkers.description: Linker(s) used during ChIA-PET library preparation

sequence.title: Linker sequence
sequence.description: The sequence of the linker ligated to the library DNA fragments.

construction_method.title: The kit or protocol technique used to generate the library of nucleic acid material being sequenced.
construction_method.description: The kit or protocol technique used to generate the library.
